intro: Dichasianthus brachycarpus, commonly known as the short-fruited dichasianthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive fruit structure. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within the Malvaceae family.
